channel.description: How would i make so that i could do like item on object (Like if you used a vial on a sink you would get a vial of water?)

item.dc:creator: @Benz Benz
item.description:
@Benz wrote:

Search for /OBJECT CLICK ONE/.
Inside the switch statement (Which is switch(objectID) { ), do:

case OBJECTID: // You don't need a: if (objectID) because it's within the switch statement.
if((actionTimer = 0 && playerHasItem(ITEMID)) { //if action timer is 0 and player has the item, do this:
deleteItem(ITEMID1, 1); // deletes item
//emote (if you want)
addItem(ITEMID2, Amount); //adds an item, then it's amount.
actionTimer += 5; //add 5 to the action timer.
} else if (actionTimer > 0) { // if Action Timer is greater than 0, proceed to the code below.
sendMessage("You need to wait before you do that again!"); // Sends Message if Action timer is
} else if (!playerHasItem(####)) { // This bit is optional, it means, if player Does not have item.
sendMessage(" "); // You could say, you need a vial to do that. Etc.
}

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

If OBJECTID == (object id put in) {
if (actionTimer (to prevent macros)
if player has the item (the vail)
delete the vail
put an emote
add the item (lets say water vail)
and actiontimer 5 so they will have to wait until the actiontimer is 0 to start over again.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

if (objectID == OBJECT ID) { if (actionTimer = 0) { if (playerHasItem(ITEM ID)) { deleteItem(ITEM, AMOUNT); pEmote = EMOTE ID; addItem(ITEM ID, AMOUNT); actionTimer = 5; } } }

And then just add it to your “object2” section and then once you’ve done that, add it to the object.cfg file.
